title: Slow-Braised Beef with Carrots and Baby Potatoes
excerpt: Beef broth, tomato paste and red wine. A comforting and flavorful dish.
introduction: This melt-in-your-mouth braised beef is the ultimate comfort food. The meat simmers gently in beef broth enriched with red wine and tomato paste, alongside carrots and baby potatoes. The result? Fork-tender beef and a velvety sauce that coats every ingredient beautifully.

items.name: beef for braising
items.note: cut into large chunks (you can use beef chuck or flank steak according to your preference)

instructions.title: Sear the beef
instructions.content: Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Sear the beef chunks 2-3 minutes per side until well browned. Remove and set aside.

instructions.title: Aromatics
instructions.content: In the same pot, sauté the onion for 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.

instructions.title: Tomato & wine
instructions.content: Stir in tomato paste and cook 30-60 seconds. Deglaze with red wine and simmer 1-2 minutes.

instructions.title: Braising
instructions.content: Return beef to the pot. Add carrots, potatoes, beef broth, bay leaf and thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Cover.

instructions.title: Slow cooking
instructions.content: Simmer on low heat for 2½ to 3 hours, until the beef is fork-tender and the sauce thickened.

instructions.title: Finish
instructions.content: Remove bay leaf. Stir in fresh basil. Adjust seasoning.

conclusion: Serve hot, topped with green onions. Perfect comfort food on its own or with crusty bread. Even better the next day! Works great in a slow cooker (8 hours on low). A small knob of butter at the end adds richness.
